content:
Diagnosis:	Peritoneal mesothelioma, Stage IIIA
	Diagnosed March 2023 following diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy
	Calretinin positive, WT-1 positive on immunohistochemistry

I reviewed [redacted name] in follow-up clinic today following completion of 6 cycles of first-line cisplatin and pemetrexed chemotherapy in December 2023. His most recent CT scan performed on 15 March 2024 shows stable disease with no significant change in the omental and peritoneal disease compared to the end-of-treatment scan. The previously noted small volume ascites has resolved.

He completed his planned chemotherapy with good tolerance, achieving disease stabilization. His CA-125 level has remained stable at 42 (previously 45). We discussed surveillance strategy, and I have arranged for a repeat CT scan in 3 months' time with clinical review. He understands to contact us sooner if he develops any new symptoms or concerns. We have provided written information about mesothelioma support services.

The plan is to continue with 3-monthly surveillance, with consideration of second-line treatment options if there is evidence of disease progression in the future.
